Posts.Content: Sorry for late response: My case is a little different than most, I took casodex for 30 days before surgery. Therefore my surgical pathology report could not determine a true gleason score or PT score. Results: Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, High grade with partial hormonal ablation therapy effect. Tumor extending focal into extraprostatic tissue. Tumor invading left seminal vesicle Right seminal vesicle and segments of vas deferentia, no tumor present Perineular present Lymphovascular invasion present Partial epithelial atrophy consistent with partial hormonal ablation theraphy effect Detached fragment of adipose tissue, no tumor present Tumor invades the left seminal vesicle including intra and extraprostitac regions Margins of resection are free of tumor 24 lymph nodes removed, no cancer Radiation Oncologist recommends radiation as soon as possible, do not wait for PSA to tick up Urologist wanted to wait and see, appointment in August So sorry in delay of getting info to you, thanks for your help and advice
Posts.Signature: Age 65 PSA History 9/8/15 5.18, 10/19/15 4.54, 3/5/16 4.91, 9/9/16 4.65, 4/25/17 5.73 Biopsy on 5/11/17 of 14 core (2) were 4/5 = Gleason 9 60% L base and (1) core 3/3 Gleason 6 5% L Trans Prostate: 4.6 X 3.3 X 4.1 cm (32 grams) On 7/28/17 had DaVinci prostatectomy at M.D. Anderson, Dr John Papadopoulos. Four hour drive home on 7/30/17, my friendly catheter out on 8/8/17 24 lymph nodes removed, no cancer

Posts.Content: Recovery was easier than expected. Met with Dr. Papadouplas at M.D. Anderson in Houston on 9-12-17 and PSA was undetectable, said results of surgery could not have been any better.
Posts.Signature: Age 65 PSA History 9/8/15 5.18, 10/19/15 4.54, 3/5/16 4.91, 9/9/16 4.65, 4/25/17 5.73 Biopsy on 5/11/17 of 14 core (2) were 4/5 = Gleason 9 60% L base and (1) core 3/3 Gleason 6 5% L Trans Prostate: 4.6 X 3.3 X 4.1 cm (32 grams) On 7/28/17 had DaVinci prostatectomy at M.D. Anderson, Dr John Papadopoulos. Four hour drive home on 7/30/17, my friendly catheter out on 8/8/17 24 lymph nodes removed, no cancer

Posts.Title: One week countdown to RALP

Posts.Content: 10. Take your wife or caregiver to dinner and thank them for helping and supporting you thru this process. Once you prepare for surgery someone will say "we will give you something to relax" next thing you are in recovery and on the good side.

Posts.Title: Age 65 with Gleason 9 Treatment Options

Posts.Content: Once all of my testing was completed I had a couple of options, radiation or surgery. First option presented was Hormone treatment and radiation sounded like a plan I was ready to get started and get treated. Next day had an appointment with urologist and he said either option should give me same results, said he was a surgeon and thought taking it out would work out real well. Two days later met with Dr John Popadopalous at MD Anderson in Houston and he agreed with surgery. Wife and I discussed and decided to get it removed, because of gleason 9, felt MD Anderson could treat cancer better IF it returned. Had surgery on 7/28/17, recovering really well. Received call from Dr. on Monday, day catheter left my body, to let me know 24 lymph nodes removed and were all cancer free. Just wanted to say thank you to everyone who has posted here, your post have helped me so much.
Posts.Signature: Age 65 PSA History 9/8/15 5.18, 10/19/15 4.54, 3/5/16 4.91, 9/9/16 4.65, 4/25/17 5.73 Biopsy on 5/11/17 of 14 core (2) were 4/5 = Gleason 9 60% L base and (1) core 3/3 Gleason 6 5% L Trans Prostate: 4.6 X 3.3 X 4.1 cm (32 grams) On 7/28/17 had DaVinci prostatectomy at M.D. Anderson, Dr John Papadopoulos. Four hour drive home on 7/30/17, my friendly catheter out on 8/8/17 24 lymph nodes removed, no cancer
Posts.Title: Age 65 with Gleason 9 Treatment Options

Posts.Content: Liked idea of getting rid of prostate and having a better idea of what was happening. Looking forward to good report when we meet with Dr on Sept. 12.

Posts.Title: Age 65 with Gleason 9 Treatment Options

Posts.Content: Had my surgery at MD Anderson in Houston, on 7/28/17, released morning of 7/30/17. Four hour trip to Lafayette, La. no problems at all, may want to ease up on stool softner medication. Nurse at hospital gave me a class on removing catheter, 10 days later was a free man, self removal was a breeze. Six week checkup on 9/12 <.1 PSA.
Posts.Signature: Age 65 PSA History 9/8/15 5.18, 10/19/15 4.54, 3/5/16 4.91, 9/9/16 4.65, 4/25/17 5.73 Biopsy on 5/11/17 of 14 core (2) were 4/5 = Gleason 9 60% L base and (1) core 3/3 Gleason 6 5% L Trans Prostate: 4.6 X 3.3 X 4.1 cm (32 grams) On 7/28/17 had DaVinci prostatectomy at M.D. Anderson, Dr John Papadopoulos.
